DND5E.ClassIdentifierHint: This calling's data will be accessible using @classes.{identifier} in roll formulas.
DND5E.ClassMakeOriginalHint: First calling taken by character used to determine certain calling traits when multiclassing.
DND5E.SubclassIdentifierHint: This identifier should match the identifier on the parent calling to ensure they are properly linked.
DND5E.SubclassAssignmentError: {class} already has a subcalling. Remove the existing '{subclass}' subcalling before adding a new one.
DND5E.SubclassDuplicateError: A subcalling with the identifier {identifier} already exists on this actor.
DND5E.SubclassMismatchWarn: {name} subcalling has no matching calling with identifier '{class}'.
DND5E.FlagsInitiativeAdvHint: Provided by virtues or magical items.
DND5E.AdvancementItemGrantHint: Grant the character items (such as equipment, virtues, or crafts) when they reach a certain level.
DND5E.AdvancementHitPointsHint: Track the player's hit points for each level in the calling.
DND5E.AdvancementLevelDownConfirmationMe: Leveling this calling down will also undo all advancement choices made for it. These changes will be removed from your character as long as the checkbox below is checked.
DND5E.AdvancementScaleValueHint: A single value that changes as a calling increases in level that is made available in roll formulas.
DND5E.HitDiceConfigHint: Adjust remaining hit dice levels for each calling.
DND5E.LongRestHint: Take a long rest? On a long rest you will recover hit points, half your maximum hit dice, calling resources, and limited use item charges.
DND5E.MaxClassLevelExceededWarn: Calling cannot be advanced past level {max}.
DND5E.MaxClassLevelMinimumWarn: Calling must have at least one level.
DND5E.PolymorphKeepClass: Keep proficiency bonus (leaves calling items in sheet)
LOTR.Settings.SpellbookToggle.name: Disable Spellbook tab
LOTR.Settings.SpellbookToggle.hint: Disables the spellbook tab on character sheets.
